{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with ptosis, difficulty in chewing, and occasional difficulty in swallowing. There is no history of diplopia or visual loss. On examination, there is symmetric ptosis and mild restriction of extraocular muscle movement. Nerve conduction study shows decremental response in orbicularis only, and ERG reveals a myopathic pattern. Anti-AchR radioimmunoassay is negative. Based on these findings, the most probable diagnosis would be Chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia (CPEO).", "answer_choice": "D"}
